events.title: Battle of Bristoe Station
events.description: During the American Civil War, Union forces under Major General Gouverneur K. Warren repelled Confederate attacks led by General A.P. Hill, marking a tactical Union victory in Northern Virginia.
events.significance: This battle halted the Confederate advance toward Washington, D.C., strengthening Union control in the region.

events.title: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
events.description: A famous 30-second shootout erupted near Tombstone, Arizona Territory, involving lawmen Wyatt Earp, Doc Holliday, and the Clanton-McLaury gang.
events.significance: The gunfight became an iconic symbol of the American Wild West law enforcement and outlaw conflicts.

events.title: First Russian Revolution Begins
events.description: Bloody Sunday protests escalated in Saint Petersburg, marking the start of widespread unrest in Russia against Tsarist autocracy.
events.significance: These events presaged the 1905 Russian Revolution, which led to limited reforms and set the stage for future upheavals.

events.title: Change in U.S. Supreme Court Chief Justice
events.description: Earl Warren was appointed as Chief Justice of the United States Supreme Court.
events.significance: Under Warren's leadership, the court would deliver landmark decisions advancing civil rights and liberties.

events.title: First Woman to Command a U.S. Naval Ship
events.description: Lt. Commander Beverly Kelley took command of the USS Opportune (ARS-41), the first woman to do so in the U.S. Navy.
events.significance: This milestone marked significant progress in gender equality within the United States armed forces.
